body.name: Ayotu Waterproof Adjustable(30 to 60 Degree) Angle Mount for Ring Video Doorbell Pro 2 & Ring Doorbell Pro, Mounting Bracket with Weatherproof Cap Wedge Corner Holder, 1Pack Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 30 mins
features: COMPATIBILITY：The doorbell angle mount is designed for Ring Video Doorbell Pro 2/Pro. Cannot be used for Ring Video Doorbell Wired(NO Camera).
ADJUSTMENT ANGLE: The adjuster can be adjusted at an angle of 30°-60°, so that the video doorbell camera can better observe visitors and things in front of the door.

WATERPROOF DESIGN: The waterproof doorbell mounting bracket design prevents rainwater from splashing on the camera and blurring the line of sight. The waterproof cap design on the regulator prevents water accumulation.
ANTI-SLIP PIECE DESIGN: The ring doorbell wedge kit adjustment screw has an anti-slip piece design, which can fix the angle well to prevent sliding when the doorbell is pressed.
SYMMETRICAL DESINGN: The ring doorbell mounting angle can be used forward and backward, which is convenient to install on the left or right to adjust the angle.

Does it include a doorbell? Without a doorbell, this is just a doorbell adjustment bracket. Will this ring doorbell angle mount work with a charging cable? Yes, there are holes specially designed to pass through the charging cable. Can this ring doorbell mounting bracket protect the doorbell from getting wet? No, it is not completely rainproof as it is not all inclusive. It can only reduce the impact on the doorbell camera in light rainy days. Does heavy rain work? The heavier the rain, the less effective the rain cover will be.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Rarely review stuff but this thing worked great in every way
reviews.reviewText: I never bother to review stuff but I was so pleased with this thing, I figured I would detail my experience in the event it would be useful to others. Replaced my original Ring Pro with a v2 pro, which from what I read does not fit the same mounting brackets as the first Ring.On my first Ring, I used one of the Ring angle mounts, which allow 3 stacking pieces to turn the camera 15 30 or 45 degrees to the side. Apparently in their infinite wisdom, Amazon who now owns Ring, only makes a limited angle mount for the v2 pro that does not do the same as the original. I bought this mount since it looked like it would work, despite being apparently one of countless cheap China made "random letter" brands that are all over Amazon. Fast forward to installing.Got the new v2 Ring and removed the old camera and angle mounts. First thing that was awesome about this new angle mount... the original mount had 2 screws mounted underneath into the stucco in specific spots that would not fit the new stock Ring angle mount or the non angled mount for the camera itself. Well this 3rd party mount actually has two vertical openings of about 1 inch each on top and bottom so to screw it into the existing guides in the stucco, you can just adjust the screws along the openings to fit the existing guides. No screwing in new guides into your stucco. Awesome.Next, after screwing in the base plate, I looked at directions and decided based on other comments to not use the rain shield. My doorbell is covered and rain isn't an issue and I didn't want the camera blocked at all. No problem. You just skip that piece. I then mounted the Ring to the bracket and per the directions... super easy. Just a few screws which are identified by letters in the instructions but you could honestly do it without reading them because it's really very obvious and self explanatory. Frankly, I saw someone say they couldn't figure out the instructions and returned this thing... you would have to be a colossal idiot to not be able to figure this thing out without instructions. It's literally half a dozen total screws with like 3 pieces of plastic that have predrilled holes... hard to screw up.After mounting the Ring, I configured it and then slid the Ring out and adjusted the angle in real time by watching it on my phone until I was happy with the angle. Amazon/Ring can't apparently produce a 50 cent piece of plastic to mount this is an intelligent way with a variety of options and angles, yet here is a 3rd party making one that gives you a wide variety of angles and adjustments that is just better top to bottom. After getting the angle where I wanted it, I tightened the screw that is pre mounted in the top and locked the angle where I wanted it, then used the included plastic piece to cover the guide piece on the top where the screw is. Device feels secure and firmly mounted, angles worked great giving a ton of options, all the screws worked without issues, nothing broke nothing stripped, it worked great from start to finish and was super simple.Honestly I could not have been happier considering my low expectations as with most of these kind of items on Amazon. Worked better than the included factory angle option, was intelligently designed enough to make replacing an existing v1 bell with a different sized v2 super easy without removing or replacing the existing holes. Thumbs up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Looks nice. Not sure how easy it was to install we procrastinate bought the doorbell and this back in like May and I decided since we hadn’t gotten around to installing I would hire someone to do it. Since we had the electrician here for something else just had him install but it took him like 45 min so don’t know if that’s a fair amount of time or too long lol.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Only option I could find
reviews.reviewText: This was really the only product I could find as an option. I do wish that there was an option for up and down since the door bell already comes with the left right angle but I knew what I was getting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Adjustable Ring Doorbell Pro 2 Mount
reviews.reviewText: I used the ONTEN vinyl siding mount 1st to creat a steady base for this adjustable mount.The ONTEN base attaches with 4-longs screws making it very ridged. I used 2-more long screws to go through the ONTEN base and then into the wood sheeting.It all looks very professional and is very sturdy. The hood keeps the elements off the lens and cuts the glare down.The combination of these 2-mounts was the perfect solution.
